intro: Myrianthemum mirabile, commonly known as the fairy clock or star flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has a low-growing habit with hairy leaves and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance. Myrianthemum mirabile is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
